subject: COMPENSATION – compulsory purchase – unoccupied house – condition adversely affecting amenity of neighbourhood – open market value – comparables – deduction for local land charges – cost of property and garden clearance – compensation assessed at £140,000

title: Kerry Lambert v Kingston Upon Hull Council
case_title: Kerry Lambert v Kingston Upon Hull Council
subject: COMPENSATION – compulsory purchase – acquisition of flat in multi-storey block – costs of unqualified lay person in advising claimant – removals and storage costs – £2,250 awarded as compensation

title: Mavis Hilda Mary Meredith v King’s Lynn & West Norfolk Borough Council
case_title: Mavis Hilda Mary Meredith v King’s Lynn & West Norfolk Borough Council
subject: COMPENSATION – Compulsory purchase – Grade II Listed house in disrepair – owner’s failure to comply with Repairs Notice or Urgent Works Notice – development prospects – cost of repair and renovation - valuation – comparables - Section 5(2) Land Compensation Act 1961- compensation determined at £125,000

title: Jon Harding & Anor v Secretary of State for Transport
case_title: Jon Harding & Anor v Secretary of State for Transport

title: Trustees of the Boulder Bridge Lane Trust v Barnsley Metropolitan Borough Council
case_title: Trustees of the Boulder Bridge Lane Trust v Barnsley Metropolitan Borough Council
subject: COMPENSATION – PLANNING PERMISSION – certificate of appropriate alternative development – compulsory purchase of former railway land – whether planning permission would have been granted for change of use of former operational building(s) said to be in Green Belt – conditions to be attached to agreed scrap yard and fuel recovery uses – ss. 17, 18 Land Compensation Act 1961 – appeal allowed

title: SME (Hammersmith) Limited v Transport for London
case_title: SME (Hammersmith) Limited v Transport for London
subject: COMPENSATION - Compulsory Purchase – leasehold franchise restaurant at Farringdon – extinguishment of business owing to Crossrail Scheme – agreed assumed maintainable earnings figure – dispute as to appropriate multiplier – comparable transactions of franchises – extinguishment value determined at £1,498,000

title: Paul Henry Richard James Newbold & Ors v The Coal Authority
case_title: Paul Henry Richard James Newbold & Ors v The Coal Authority
subject: COMPENSATION – mining subsidence – preliminary issues – whether damage to Wentworth Woodhouse “subsidence damage” – Coal Mining Subsidence Act 1991

title: Michael Michael v Salford City Council
case_title: Michael Michael v Salford City Council
subject: COMPENSATION – Compulsory Purchase – site in Salford – CPO as part of wider scheme – planning permissions – methods of valuation – residual method preferred – profits of development claim rejected in addition to market value - basic loss and other costs – compensation awarded at £321,702.61 – Section 5, Land Compensation Act 1961.

title: Richard Gordon Burge & Anor v South Gloucestershire Council
case_title: Richard Gordon Burge & Anor v South Gloucestershire Council
subject: COMPENSATION –  Tree Preservation Order – cracks appearing in conservatory – refusal of consent to fell oak tree on adjoining land – claim for cost of rebuilding conservatory – whether loss or damage reasonably foreseeable when consent refused – whether loss or damage foreseeable by claimants when conservatory erected – compensation awarded at £25,000 - Town and Country Planning Act 1990, s203

title: Mark Goodman & Ors v Transport for London
case_title: Mark Goodman & Ors v Transport for London
subject: COMPENSATION – Land Compensation Act 1973 Part I – dwelling houses – depreciation in value from physical factors caused by the Coulsdon Relief Road – relevance of noise evidence – valuation evidence based upon transactions and agreed values – transactions preferred – compensation determined at 1% and 4% of agreed switched off values.

title: Robert Lindley Limited v East Riding of Yorkshire Council
case_title: Robert Lindley Limited v East Riding of Yorkshire Council
subject: COMPENSATION – Flooding– claim for crop losses caused by diversion of floodwaters away from built property – whether respondent Council acting as lead local flood authority under the provisions of ss 14 and 14A Land Drainage Act 1991 – whether assistance from, and actions of, the Environment Agency and the Fire Service given as agents of the Council under doctrine of agency - compensation agreed at £14,500.

title: Ranjana Zeena Parmar v The London Borough of Barnet
case_title: Ranjana Zeena Parmar v The London Borough of Barnet
subject: COMPENSATION – compulsory purchase – acquisition of derelict detached house – valuation method – redevelopment value – basic loss payment where no application made before hearing

title: Sheila Grace Hall v London Borough of Hillingdon
case_title: Sheila Grace Hall v London Borough of Hillingdon
subject: COMPENSATION – compulsory purchase – land acquired  pursuant  to a s.106 Agreement connected with major development of offices and park on reclaimed land – whether special value (if any) to developer to be left out of account under

title: Andrew John Bolton v Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council
case_title: Andrew John Bolton v Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council
subject: COMPENSATION – Costs – construction of compromise agreement – freedom of parties to freely agree and express that which they have agreed

title: G & B Compressor Hire Limited v The Greater London Authority
case_title: G & B Compressor Hire Limited v The Greater London Authority
subject: COMPENSATION - Compulsory purchase of 0.49 acre waste transfer station required pursuant to the London 2012 Olympic Park development - disturbance - loss of opportunity to expand business - temporary loss of profits - additional costs of new site not providing value for money – increased costs due to temporary relocation -  professional fees - Land Compensation Act 1961 section 5, Rule (6)  - compensation determined at £671,004

title: Aysin Behchet v London Borough of Southwark
case_title: Aysin Behchet v London Borough of Southwark
subject: COMPENSATION – compulsory purchase – empty house – sale by auction on building lease – whether auction price was key to value of freehold interest – comparable evidence – indexation – open market value determined at £800,000

title: Maria Da Silva v London Borough of Brent
case_title: Maria Da Silva v London Borough of Brent
subject: COMPENSATION – disturbance – surveyor’s and legal fees – claimant’s personal time and costs – rule 6 losses – need for evidence to justify claim – lack of direct evidence from claimant – unexplained estimates insufficient – summary assessment of routine items

title: Hamish G Johnston & Ors v TAG Farnborough Airport Limited
case_title: Hamish G Johnston & Ors v TAG Farnborough Airport Limited
subject: Compensation – injurious affection – cost protection – reciprocal capping – section 29, Tribunal Courts and Enforcement Act 2007 – rule 10(7), Tribunal Procedure (Upper Tribunal)(Lands Chamber) Rules 2010
